intro: Pentanema indicum var. sivarajanianum, commonly known as the Sivarajania pentanema, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the monsoon season. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
